summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing overtime staffing at a Bureau of Prisons facility, specifically concerning voluntary versus mandatory overtime for shifts on August 9-10, 2019. The correspondence expresses concern that if the union learns this information is being used against them, they may instruct staff to stop volunteering for overtime, forcing mandatory assignments.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Mentioned as the only officer whose Saturday overtime was not voluntary, in contrast to other staff.

persons.name: Hurwitz
persons.context: Sender of an email providing overtime staffing data for August 9-10, 2019, and indicates the Warden is obtaining a breakdown of mandated vs. volunteer overtime.

events.title: Friday Overtime Shift
events.description: Overtime shift from 4pm to 12am with 21 posts, 20 staff present, and 6 overtime assignments.

events.title: Saturday Overtime Shift
events.description: Overtime shift from 12am to 8am with 19 posts, 18 staff present, and 10 overtime assignments. Officer Noel's overtime was noted as not voluntary.

keyFacts: The email discusses overtime staffing at a Bureau of Prisons facility for August 9-10, 2019.
All overtime was voluntary except for one instance involving Officer Noel on Saturday.
There is expressed concern that if the union learns this data is being used against them, they may instruct staff to stop volunteering for overtime, leading to mandatory assignments.
